channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I hate shopping. ChatGPT is already helping me in ways Google never did
item.description: ChatGPT can act as a personal stylist and shopping assistant, something far beyond what a Google search offers.

item.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Revive Ban on Transgender Troops
item.description: Lower courts had blocked the policy, saying it was not supported by evidence and violated equal protection principles.

item.title: Saying ‘Thank You’ to Chat GPT Is Costly. But Maybe It’s Worth the Price.
item.description: Adding words to our chatbot can apparently cost tens of millions of dollars. But some fear the cost of not saying please or thank you could be higher.

item.title: Nearly half of Gen Z and Millennials say college was a waste of money—AI has already made degrees obsolete
item.description: College graduates are calling their degrees worthless, thanks to student loans, a fuzzy job market, and AI.

item.title: At this rate, measles could become endemic again within 2 decades, researchers warn
item.description: If vaccination rates don't pick up, says study, measles and other diseases "could become household names again."

item.title: Commercial real-estate giant CBRE sees choppy waters ahead due to tariffs: ‘Our outlook has become less clear’
item.description: “Things went from really good to not as good,” CBRE chairman and chief executive Bob Sulentic said in an earnings call Thursday.

item.title: Kristi Noem’s Handbag Was Snatched From Beneath Her Chair, D.H.S. Says
item.description: Ms. Noem “could feel this person as they snatched her bag,” a spokeswoman for the Department of Homeland Security said.

item.title: Duolingo’s CEO has one golden rule and 5 essential traits when it comes to hiring
item.description: One of Luis von Ahn approved hiring traits includes bringing the vibes to the office—that's music to Gen Z’s ears.

item.title: Stocks Extend Gains as Investors Weigh Fed Rates and Tariff Talk
item.description: After an early wobble, markets resumed rising after Chinese officials pushed back on comments from President Trump and others suggesting that tariffs ...

item.title: Trump Tells Putin to ‘STOP!’ After Deadly Russian Attack on Kyiv
item.description: The attack, which killed at least 12 people, was the deadliest on Ukraine’s capital in nearly a year. President Trump called on President Vladimir V. ...

item.title: Trump Tells Putin to ‘STOP!’ After Deadly Russian Attack on Kyiv
item.description: The attack, which killed at least 12 people, was the deadliest on Ukraine’s capital in nearly a year. President Trump called on President Vladimir V. ...

item.title: Russia Launches Large Aerial Attack on Kyiv, Killing at Least Nine People
item.description: The attack, the biggest on the capital since last summer, came hours after the Trump administration threatened to walk away from peace talks between R...

item.title: Overlooked Clue Sheds Light on Shakespeare’s Marriage
item.description: New research undermines the traditional view that Shakespeare was a distant, neglectful husband to his wife, Anne.

item.title: Why the Winner of Canada’s Election Could Be Decided by Greater Toronto
item.description: The Conservatives had enjoyed a lead over Liberals in the region largely because of rising housing and food costs. But President Trump’s tariffs have ...

item.title: Student Stabs 4 Others, One Fatally, at a French High School
item.description: The motive was unclear for the attack, which occurred at a time of heightened concern in France about knife attacks in schools.
